remarks: Define the class of simply connected topologies.  A topology is simply connected if it is path-connected and every loop (continuous path with identical start and endpoint) is contractible to a point (path-homotopic to a constant function).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Feb-2015.) (New usage is discouraged.)
